## Installing R and RStudio

To get started, you'll need to install R and RStudio on your computer. 

**For installation instructions and downloads, please visit**: [Epiverse-TRACE Software Setup](https://epiverse-trace.github.io/tutorials-early/index.html#software-setup). This guide will assist you with installing R and RStudio, including checking your R version and updating if needed.

### Unable to install locally?

If you're unable to install R and RStudio on your laptop, you can use **Posit Cloud** instead. Posit Cloud provides a free cloud-based RStudio environment that you can access from any web browser.

**Get started with a free Posit Cloud account**: [Posit Cloud Plans](https://posit.cloud/plans)

## Installing R Packages

Install the required R packages using the following code in your R console:

```r
if(!require("pak")) install.packages("pak")
pak::pkg_install(
  "epiverse-trace/readepi@readepi_no_his_spc_deps",
  "cleanepi@1.1.0",
  "reactable",
  "rio",
  "here",
  "DBI",
  "RSQLite",
  "dbplyr",
  "linelist",
  "simulist",
  "incidence2",
  "epiverse-trace/tracetheme",
  "tidyverse"
)
```

## Getting Help with R Basics

If you're new to R or need a refresher, here are some recommended resources:

- **Epidemiologist R Handbook**: Comprehensive guide to R fundamentals for epidemiologists. Start with the [R Basics chapter](https://www.epirhandbook.com/en/new_pages/basics.html).

- **R for Data Science**: A more general introduction to R and coding: [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/intro.html)

## Next Steps

Once you have R and RStudio installed:

1. Visit the [Data](data.qmd) section to download example datasets.
2. Explore the [Tasks](task1.qmd) menu to find the analytical task(s) you're interested in.
3. Join your assigned group and start working through the materials with facilitator support.
